text:
Zametov smiled, his dark face flushed. 

“What, you here?” he exclaimed. 

Raskolnikov laid aside the papers. 

“I know you have,” he replied, irritation creeping in. 

“You looked for my sock,” he continued. 

“And Razumihin has lost his heart to you.” 

Zametov chuckled. 

“Who’s been pouring champagne into you just now?” 

“We’ve just been having a drink,” he said. 

“By way of a fee! You profit by everything!” 

Raskolnikov laughed, slapping Zametov on the shoulder. 

“What a hot head he is!” 

“Do you remember the Explosive Lieutenant?” 

Zametov nodded, puzzled. 

“Of course, it was clear!” Raskolnikov said, smiling.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov encounters Zametov in a restaurant, revealing a mix of humor and irritation in their conversation.
